ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Never had any experience playing an instrument, and this course gave me something I thought I would never have.
I learned how to play Javanese Gamelan music!
Playing new instruments in an ensemble setting, learning about the Central Javanese Gamelan tradition.
Learned the basics of various Indonesian instruments.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
I love the simplicity of the instruments. Some were a bit more difficult but none that I thought I couldn't get a good grasp. 

I would only suggest that we practice in the same positioning we would be in the performace.
The class was mostly centered on rehearsal, and I enjoyed how the class was set up as students were able to get exposure to several different Gamelan instruments.

Strengths: engaging without being stressful, accessible to different levels of musicianship with opportunities to take on more difficult responsibilities / parts.

Weaknesses: not many! Perhaps could have more focus on engaging with the (optional) readings at the beginning of the semester so everyone is on the same page of general background knowledge; it was unclear how many students knew (or didn't know) the names of the instruments, because the readings were optional. Attendance was also sometimes an issue, which caused the in-class rehearsals to be missing certain parts / sounds.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to all Yale students. This is the most therapeutic course I have taken at Yale. It just felt good playing music, learning instruments, and seeing the progress that we made in such a short time. And the melodies are so soothing! But if you are lucky to get into this course PLEASE SHOW UP EVERY TIME...ON TIME. It's only once a week and doesn't require much outside practice, so you should be able to fully commit to this, not withstanding emergencies.
Absolutely! I enjoyed the course, and the final concert was wonderful!
Absolutely! A low-stakes way of engaging with something new for probably most Yale students, whether they are new to music entirely or Central Javanese gamelan.
Yes! No assignments other than the final performance which takes up most of a day. Excellent as a 5th class and so fun to be able to learn a new type of music.
